review: I came here to order a burger to go. I haven't been to a Red Robin in ages and I was interested in the "Gourmet Burger" sign. They are new but fully opened, not just "soft open", but they didn't take "to go" orders. The reason I heard from the waitress was that they didn't want to "overload" the kitchen. The logic puzzled me, "to go" or "for here" I would still be putting in one order, so the kitchen would have the same load. I think the real reason behind it is to make the restaurant looks "fuller". I waited a total of 35 minutes from walking in the door to leaving the restaurant with my order "for here but in a box". I ordered the Burnin' Love Burger, well-done. It smelled so good in car and I thought, "OK, this is worth it. I will enjoy my burger". I got back to work and opened up the box. Everything still looks OK, the bread buns look good, french fries look good, and I took my first bite. This is where things went down hill. The only Burnin' sensation I had was the burning desire to scream for my 12 bucks and 35 minutes of my life back. It was not well done and if stale lettuce is "gourmet" then I hit the jackpot.  Perhaps the newest of the restaurant is a factor here; however, if they are not ready to grand open then they should soft open. Anyway, I love food and I would pay whatever to get good food. I didn't get a good hamburger from Red Robin that day.

This Red Robin is a moderately brand new addition to Lacey in the new shopping center that is right behind the Safeway on Marvin Rd. We went to this Red Robin at about 5:30- 6:00 pm. Many people might think it would be super busy, but the wait was only like 10 minutes, which I didn't think was too bad at a peak time. Alas, we only had two people in our party though, so we were easy to seat.  I always love Red Robin, but I tried not to go in with a bias in my mind. We were seated and our server came very quickly to take our drink order.  We got pretzel bites as an appetizer. They were good, but nothing super special. Then the party started....literally. There was a table of about 8 next to use with multiple birthdays and that same ole Happy Birthday song and dance we all are privy to came as the servers gathered and wished the little kiddies well. We joined in and clapped, laughed, sang, and smiled our way through the song along with other in the restaurant. It's kind of amazing how fun it is. Don't be awkward, join in, even if it's not your birthday. It makes people feel good :) Anyway, soon after the entrees came. I ordered the basic Boca burger. The burger comes disassembled with the pickles, onions, & tomatoes on the side. I am not sure if they have the endless fries anymore because we got like 10-15 steak cut fries with the burgers in a little silver ring. They used to bring them in a basket and they truly were endless. Maybe, as someone mentioned, this is a privately owned franchise so maybe they're cutting costs where they can.  The Boca burger and also the sides (tomato and pickles) along with the fries were dry. The burger itself was edible but seemed as if it endured the same cooking procedure as the regular meat burgers, which normally tends to dry out boca "meat". I'm glad we got onion ring sauce and barbecue and ketchup. It helps to moisten things up.  I think there are still some things that are not operational or not trained yet like to-go orders. Or maybe they just don't do to-go orders when its peak hours to minimize the amount of extra work in the kitchen. Anyway, our server was able to make a "to-go" order happen for us. I am giving 4 stars, or really 3.5 stars because of how fast the whole process was, how fast the food came out, the short wait at a peak hour, the food was decent but not overwhelming, the service was nice and friendly and informative. Stars subtracted because that parking lot is going to bad once there are more businesses in there and a half a star because the food was only decent and not overwhelming as well as there were only 2-4 items for vegetarians.  Oh and on a side note, I was kind of bothered that of all of the three TVs in our section, all of them had the same sports game on. It would be nice to have a little variation and have each TV with a different sports game on. Or maybe not just have a "sports bar" feel as families are actually coming there. Maybe put on a sitcom or NBC or something. Just a note

Thought  I would try the new Red Robin in Lacey since I live close by. Usually I go to Olympia.  So sorry I didn't.  First the dining area is just to crowed with tables,  you have to squeeze by and disturb people in order to get to the bathroom.   I ordered the patty melt . The meat was thin and small and you could put the whole thing on a half slice of bread. Plus the meat was tasteless.  Even the fries were bad. Oily and not done enough.

Our food beat the drinks from the bar. The bar team is pretty rookie, 1 drink at a time. The BLT came with only 1 piece of bacon as if it was in the sand which by mistake. Its a new place, needs to keep looking for the right staff.

The food at this location is as good as it gets for Red Robin.  I have been there a few times now and my food has been hot, fresh, and prepared correctly, unlike the Olympia Red Robin.  I will be happy to come back.

I give it five stars because of our waitress, I wish I could remember her name, but she is the reason I come back despite the wait and minimum parking.  We got our food and of course fries because they are bottomless.  She went to get our second batch of fries and we noticed it was taking longer than normal.  She finally brought them out and said the ones she was about to bring out we're cold so she had them make us fresh ones.  Awesome customer service.  Food was great too so that helps the five stars.

We were in Lacey after a visit to Cabelas, and starved! Short wait for dinner, about 5 minutes. Place was packed at 8pm on a Friday night, and stayed busy. First impression was poor. While we waited, the manager walked in the front door, snapped his fingers in a hostess's face and barked, "Kim, come!" as if she were a trained dog. Appalling behavior and no way to treat staff. She and the other staff seemed unfazed by this, so I have to assume it's normal behavior for him (and them). But we were starving, so we took out seats. Rest of the experience was terrific, best we've had at any Red Robin. Chelsey was an amazing waitress, prompt, professional, cheerful, cute as can be. We told her how hungry we were, so she took our order and then immediately brought us hot, fresh steak fries. Awesome! We had burgers, Both were fresh, delicious, cooked just right, and the best we've had at a Red Robin (or maybe anywhere, save LunchBox Laboratory in Bellevue or Gordon Ramsay BurGR in Las Vegas). Would have been 5 stars, but for the appalling behavior by the management.

Very good food quality as expected from Red Robin. Clean and inviting interior and family friendly. If you like real burgers instead of fast food fake burgers and haven't tried a Red Robin, you really need to try one out. Very good prices especially considering the quality of the food, and right now they have endless fries.

I've been eating at Red Robin since the time there was just one restaurant, so it's hard not to compare. Now it is a corporate behemoth and its shows in their food. However it does feel like they've remained fairly faithful to their origins and the quality is still pretty high. This new store in Lacey feels rushed, cramped and cold.

This place is a major improvement over the Olympia location. Yes, the waits can be long but they can text you when your table is ready and even give you a link to check your place in line. Our server was Kari and she was GREAT! Very clean, friendly, and cozy.

This place started off pretty hectic and did not have good service at all!! But now they got it together its a new location.. The food has always been perfect! I have food allergies they have never contaminated my food gluten free burgers and fries are great! Staff is always friendly place is clean. I come here for my gluten free burger fix..

We have eaten at nearly every Red Robin in western Washington so i could not miss out on a new location. This was convenient on our way to Portland from Bellevue.  Our server was friendly and the food came quickly. No complaints and our fries were super hot.  This location seems a bit on the small side  but we did not have to wait so that did not matter to us. Still it was busy for an after lunch rush.

I usually have great service at Red Robin however last week when I went on the 20th it was a totally different story! My friend and I went to the bar since the restaurant was packed. We ordered drinks and appetizers to start. My friend ordered the pretzel bites and asked for mustard instead of cheese, I asked her if she could bring out the cheese as well so I could taste it. The pretzels came out with just the cheese, no mustard for my friend. It took her awhile to come back so we could tell her about the mustard. When she returned she saw my friend's soda was empty and asked if he wanted a refill. My alcoholic beverage was empty as well, but she didn't ask if I needed another drink. Our meals came out and I wasn't happy with the salad dressing I got. I waited and waited for her to come back so I could request a different dressing. By the way, I still didn't get another drink. After waiting so freaking long I lost my appetite and stopped eating my salad, and when she finally walked by I had to tell her that I wanted another drink. Never once did she come by to see if our meal was ok.  Her name was Ed. If you ever see her you should run! If I knew the service was going to suck so bad I would have just went to the pho restaurant next door.

Service sucks. Our waitress was down right rude. Its freezing anywhere but the bar, and the food and drinks (although not bad) are so-so. I like RR  but this location needs a lot of work. And frankly with so many better options nearby, its kinda sad that such a great addition to the area is so lack luster. Ill be back in a few months to try again but for now there is NO reason for me to return.

My daughter and I tried this Red Robin and were very disappointed. We were sat to the right of the door and we were cold our entire visit.  The lobby design was a stupid move on the architects part.  The door lets cold in every time the door opens and it goes straight to the dining area.  Red Robin is a busy place which translates into cold drafts into the dining area every few minutes. I had to keep my down jacket on the entire meal.  That sucked. Our server was pretty aloof and non chalant and we didnt seem much of him.   My fries were lukewarm and I counted 8 on my plate. No joke.  I hate that their "bottomless fries" means you have to act like a pig and ask for two orders to make up what would be a usual amount at any other restaurant. Not only do you have to ask for more but it takes 5-8 minutes to get them so your burger is mostly gone by the time you get them. This annoys me so much that I about done going to Red Robin. Just put a regular sized order on the plate and stop saying they are bottomless. It is a stupid gimmick and is just annoying. Burger was good. Meh. Whatever.

Our family loves red robin I have never had a bad experience at any until I ate at this one.  My first experience was just okay but I decided since they were brand new that maybe they were still working out their operation.  Boy was I wrong when I went there today they were overwhelmed with tables and I felt really bad for the wait staff.  When our food came we still didn't have silverware and my two year old had to wait about ten minutes until my husband got up and asked a random employee for some.  I had requested an extra plastic cup for the milkshake I order it never came.  When the assistant manger asked us if we needed anything I asked for the cup again she said of course no problem nothing.  By the third request I asked and still nothing so I asked for it to be taken off.  The manager came over and took if off and was extremely apologetic which was nice.  I feel like the wait staff was not properly trained and felt bad for them and they were understaffed. I will not be going back to this red robin.   Word of advice go the Olympia Red Robin!

Wasn't thrilled but I'm sure we'll give it another try at some point. this place is new and they might need some time to get settled in. Brrrr. Cold. How could they have NOT  included a double door entry? Every time the door opened, freezing air came rushing in.  Service was slow - and they were not that busy. Food tasted pretty good (typical gourmet burgers/fries). You know that's what you want when you go to a R.R. Ok... now this is a small thing but......   It was late... we were obviously very tired... had just spent hours waiting in the emergency room with a friend who needed stitches. We mentioned this to waitress. We ordered a lot for 2 people -- an appetizer,  2 entrees, and 2 rather expensive specialty drinks.  My son, 23,  spilled his drink ( an alcoholic milk-shake thing). We ordered another. I just think it would have been a REALLY NICE GESTURE if the waitress has made it on the house. NOT EXPECTED... just would have made a big difference to us.  We eat out a lot - and this place already has left us with a bad feeling.
I hear the service at this location is below par, I've only been to this location once and everything seemed normal...how can you go wrong with never ending strawberry lemonade and French fries?

First of all this place is freezing cold inside!!no double door entry so all the cold air comes in constantly. The location is small & is over cramped with too many tables. When we walked in there were no greeters to put us down for a table & lots of other people crowding the doorway waiting for those greeters. That night there were 4 on shift, as we seen later, no idea where they where when we walked in. We waited for a table a good while about 40 min, but the whole time there was a big empty table in front of us awkwardly put where all the servers & customers would run into. Oddly enough we were given that table, almost 20 minutes after it had been cleared. Food was meh nothing memorable or to write about. My oldest definitely didn't like his burger. Our adult drinks were nothing special either. They did messed up my husbands order. Most of the employees were rude. Our waitress was pretty nice though. I do think she had too many tables & forgot to bring us drinks, napkins, & silverware. In all, too expensive for what it is. I'd rather go to mcdonalds.
Great place to eat. We've eaten there 5 or 6 times. Pretty much what you expect out of a Red Robin. Good eats for a good price.

I was shocked to see how crowded this place was.  Their burgers are decent which is what I expected from a chain restaurant.  I had their Whiskey River BBQ burger and it was good but not great.  Their bottomless fries were tasty and always came out piping hot.  Service was good.  Still debating whether or not I will be back.

We went here to have a nice family dinner and the staff was nice enough. That's why I gave two stars and not one. The table that we sat at was pointless for a 4 person party as it was this tiny table with slanted leaves. Not only was the table pointless but the table was set up in a main walkway. Great thinking guys. Again, staff was really nice and I'm sure the food would have been Red Robin quality but that was just asinine.

Very busy so service took a while, but they were very friendly and helpful.  Food was very delicious of course.  Since it is a popular place there are a lot of people eating there and not enough workers to accommodate the ratio.  Also it's a newer business in the area so it might take a while for more workers to start working there.  Or maybe once the regular workers get into a routine then it will be quicker service.  It seems the workers work well together and have great teamwork with each other

I've eaten here quite often. The food is always very consistently good. The servers are always very friendly. This is our fallback restaurant if we don't where else to go. We always get the bruschetta chicken with garlic fries. Very yummy!

While the food is decent rhe service and atmosphere is not. The place is incredibly small ans therefore makes it loud. I walked in to pick up my To go order and the lady at the bar walked right past me without saying anything haha. Everyone seemed rude for all of the 2 minutes that I was inside. Probably wont be going back just because of their service.

Slow service. Seated people before us even though there were plenty of tables. Apathetic staff didn't seem to care that we had two small children. Cold food. Ran out of helium and crayons. Took forever to get napkins and silverware. Food was also poorly done too much sauce & mushy hamburgers. Restaurant was freezing cold. I suspect they had a back door open or something. Go to the Olympia location instead. Poorly managed all around this one.

We came here for my birthday lunch and I had to try the ghost burger which means it has a ghost pepper sauce, fried and fresh jalapenos ..!!  Wowza super tasty it will keep your taste buds awake!!  Our server Roxanne was great service gets 5 stars

You can't go wrong with a burger & beer here. Let's get real: either one of them are pretty hard to screw up.  What I liked about this place is they now have the option to choose your bun for your burger as well as the side option! Why yes, thank you I will take the BOTTOMLESS side salad instead of french fries!! After all, I'm not looking for a heart attack or a big butt, just a Coors Light & cheeseburger after a day of hiking - I earned it!

I tried the Lacey location recently, and was pretty disappointed in our service.  We went on the Fourth of July, 2014 and had quite poor service, which I found to be unusual for a Red Robin, which has been fast and friendly in the past.   The servers were not attentive at all and did not refill our drinks.   Further, we expected to get an advertised 10% military discount per the promotion running for the 4th, but were denied because we weren't Red Robin rewards members... , and actually I still have no idea what that means, as it wasn't explained.  All in all, that seemed terribly distasteful for a Fourth of July promotion and it was especially disappointing because I have generally had positive experiences at RR restaurants all over the U.S.    There's absolutely no reason to take your family to Red Robin if not for the service, I can get a burger anywhere, and cheaper,

As we all know, red robin is a chain eatery. I was unpleasantly surprised by its lack of usual consistency compared to the others I've been to. My usual order looked nothing like well.... My usual order. The wrap was half the size and missing ingredients. The fries were doused in grease ( don't get me wrong, I know fries aren't healthy but I also know there ways to drain a little grease). As a server myself, I care about the food I present to my customers so I wasn't a monster about it( nor do I send things back) but I did inform our server that the wrap was missing a few things. She wasn't rude about it but I did hear the whole conversation behind the kitchen line about it. Kinda tacky, if u ask me?! I ate half and she kindly and unexpectedly took the wrap off my bill. The service wasn't awful but I'll defiantly be sticking to Olympia's red robin.

Pretty good service, I usually sit in the bar, was in there on Wednesday and the gentleman server was pretty rad. He was on top of things, smiled and apologized if he took a little longer getting refills. With servers, sometimes they seem not very genuine, but he was awesome! That being said, I had some chicken strips and felt really ill later, not sure what it was due to ( the food or maybe just getting sick?) so ill probably stay away from those just in case, but ill be back!

Food is always the same at every red robin so it is decent here. Definitely affordable. However they hardly give you any fries and the refills take forever. Yes, the fries are bottomless BUT if you're only gonna give me 8 fries, at least bring them faster! Even refilling drinks here is painfully slow. I've never had to wait long for a table here but I just don't think it's worth going to for the slow service.

1. Smoke filled environment.  2. Incredibly loud yelling in kitchen area.  3. Salad not brought out till food.  4. No silverware/napkin until asked for specifically after food had been there 10 minutes.  5. Never filled water.  6. Took 20 min. for fry refill when bottomless fries is specialty. Then they brought garlic fries for my hubby when regular were ordered.  They were nasty!  7. Very disappointed!

Red robin use to be the ish back in the day.  Now its just become meh to me. their never ending steak fries are a staple but the past few times i have been at a red robin they have resorted to sending out fries that have been sitting under a warmer. Believe me there is a difference in taste and texture. Up your game RR!
Great food, poor service.  Very crowded and understaffed.  The burgers were almost worth the wait.

For a Red Robin I completely disagree with the negative reviews.  We've been here 5-6 times and have always had good food and awesome service.  I travel for work and eat at a lot of restaurants.  The service here has been better than many high end restaurants I eat at.  Thanks to Ashley (sp?) for tonight's awesome service and all the other servers who have treated us so well.  We appreciate it.

Busy restaurant at lunchtime! There were half a dozen people waiting in the lobby, so I proceeded to the bar. The bar was busy as well, but it was a Friday plus it was payday for a lot of people. The bartender acknowledged me as soon as I arrived, and she was quick paced and efficient. I ordered the California Chicken Burger, and the food came out quicker than I expected. Great sandwich, and I opted for broccoli instead of fries. The only suggestion I have is that their broccoli is somewhat plain and has very little seasoning. It would be much improved if they steamed it with some sort of garlic butter or garlic seasoning. The chicken burger was great, though!  Be sure to join the Red Robin Royalty program. In addition to getting every 10th item free, you'll get a free birthday burger that can be used any time during your birthday month.

We've been going to red robins all over the area and this location is the worst so far. Very small which leads to a huge wait time for a table.  3 out of 5 times we had mistakes with our order.  Missing food or wrong items.  Coincidence? Maybe. I can get over that kind of stuff. Honestly it's the cramped quarters that stops me from coming back.

Waited 20 minutes for 3 glasses of water. While it is Friday night, service should be no different no matter what. Our prices of the food we buy remain the same. Not impressed this time, and haven't even received our food yet.

What should have been a ten minute wait like we were told walking in, turned into almost half an hour for three people.  This is my third time here. Two out of three I had a bad experience.  I would not recommend if you have plans, or need to be somewhere.

My family really likes red robins hamburgers. This particular one was on our way and we thought we'd get a bite to eat since we were stuck in traffic. Big mistake. The hostess were very disorganized and the food was cold and sub par. The manager was kind and seemed to be running around helping out. We ordered the new buffalo chicken wings and they were NOT edible. We do enjoy Red Robin though, just not this location. We will stick to ordering burgers!

So tasty. Good service and good food. We came during the dinner rush so considering the pressure our waitress was under she was friendly, quick to refill our drinks, and asking if we needed anything else.

This is the newest red robin in the Olympia area and I am really disappointed in the food.  While I know they're busy that's no excuse for under done burgers,  incorrect order,  and tasteless au jus.  We had poor service at the west side red robin and their newest restaurant is just as bad.  I'm done with Red Robin.

Keri (maybe Teri?) at the bar was great. Good drinks very quickly for as busy as this place was on a Saturday night.  The burger was a huge sloppy disappointment. Have had the Bleu Ribbon often enough to know what it can taste like. The bun was tough - either over toasted or stale, maybe both. Burger itself was good but over sauced and the bleu cheese was disproportionate. Fries were lukewarm.  Four stars for the service. Two for the food and the zoo this place is.

I normally love red robin locations. This is a new one and I have yet to go here. It's pretty small and I was kinda shocked by really how small it is. the food was good but it took soooo long to even get utensils. I asked twice and never received any for my table and my cousin asked ( total of 3 times). I don't know why there weren't any on the table to begin with like the other tables.  The seating is so narrow too. You're literally squeezing to get to the inside tables.  I was waiting for maybe 10 minutes for the bill too bc no one checked on us towards the end and my group needed to leave.  I really do enjoy red robin, I just think this location needs to be bigger and have better service.

The waitress was friendly, not that fast or attentive. I'd say distracted and maybe a little new at her job. The employees were goofing off and I even seen and heard some inappropriate behavior on the floor that was not very professional between and male and female employees. The food was not that great either, definitely not to my standards of Red Robin and it is a restaurant we like to go to especially when we are away from home. We always get the same quality of food and service, however this one was definetly different. The parking lot was crowded and we barely found a place to park. When we were leaving there was a car and SUV issue where one parked over the line and the other one couldn't even get into his vehicle. Jerk attitudes. maybe the whole town is weird IDK, but I wont be back to this RR again.
I found the Garden Burger and sweet potato fries to be delicious. Paired with the Blood Orange Margarita.  In heaven.  Went towards closing. Still got decent service on the bar side.

My boyfriend asked for a Tavern Double and wanted the meat a little pink. The waitress said that they only came well done as they "just whip 'em up real quick" then suggested to have the Tavern Burger because they could cook the patty as requested. My boyfriend then wondered "Did we just get told that the tavern Double burger patties are pre-cooked? If so, kinda disappointing for a gourmet burger place.

This is a great place to go for dinner or lunch. The prices are reasonable and the service has always been speedy. They have alot of different burgers and they have some they switch out for the seasons. They come up with some pretty tasty burgers. They also have gluten free for anyone in your group needing that.

the best burgers, fries and drinks in town!!  who can go wrong with the bottomless fries and drinks!!  good prices and good atmosphere. Great staff, always very friendly and welcoming.   and to be so close to home is a bonus!!!

5 different servers came to our table so we never really knew who our server was. My wifes burger was wrong and fries cold. She watched me eat then I watched her eat. It took more than 20 mins for a refill on my bottom less fries and I never got a drink refill.

Love this Red Robin compared to others. We always sit at the bar and the waitresses are always so nice and talk to you like you see each other all of the time. We never feel rushed, even during dinner hour when it's packed. And hands down, the best Blue Moon!

For how much staff they have hired, you'd think service was a bit more attentive.  But my last experience I ordered a burger with a little pink left, and got a burnt burger, if I hadn't had to go to a movie I'd asked for a new one.  The appetizers are always good here, drinks were great.  Could also have better seating, the 2 seat booths are really cramped.

Classic franchise burger joint, good food, attentive and professional. Down part? Well their bottomless fries have grown a bottom, meaning don't expect refill lamas you might have grown accustomed to! Thanks to corporate I suppose!

Been awhile since we've been here now I know why we haven't been back. 1st host went to seat us and we walked all around and back to waiting area since our table was taken. Then she sat us at a table made for 2 with mini fold out side, party of 4 hilarious. Place wasn't busy either. But she said table were taken. Waitress was rude...if you hate your job go work some place else. Food..... fries old and stale beer flat onion tower ok. Burger were so so buns soaked in grease and stale.. guess we won't be back. IfI can rate a negative I would have. And forget about getting refills...

I had the banzai burger but it we the first time I regretted the pineapple on my burger. It just didn't fit my taste this time. Other than that it tasted great with the garlic fries. The server was kind and interactive.

Went here with my whole family after my college graduation. Wanted to watch the U.S. Women's World Cup game which the server was more than accommodating for. However, she never gave us silverware or napkins. Not sure if they got lost in the transition from the patio but she never asked us if we needed any. Hard to eat onion rings with sauce when you have two plates and no napkins.  Everyone ordered burgers and no one liked theirs. One ordered theirs without lettuce on it but realized it had lettuce on it once she got it. Asked for it to be made without the lettuce on it. The server returned with the exact same burger with the lettuce badly scraped off. Overall not a great experience or worth the price for some poorly done burger and a small handful of fries.
Service was slow, server asked if we wanted more fries, we said yes but never got them. Dirty tables all over and it was not busy. Not my favorite Red Robin.
Packed and busy is the norm here. But don't seat us at the table that hasn't been wiped off yet. Well what do you expect from a sixteen year old hostess.

We were hungry, and this time we didn't have a wheelchair user in our party, so we decided to stop by. And it was even worse than the last time! We chose to sit in the bar since everyone in our party was over 21 and we didn't feel like waiting. The server was rather abrupt when she walked up with menus and taking drink orders, but it was busy and we aren't fussy people. The real problem came after our food came by, and we realized we didn't have napkins. I ordered a messy burger so I wasn't able to start eating without a napkin, so I munched on fries while trying to make eye contact with the server....who was behind the bar....chatting with the bartender. I even made eye contact one time, and she turned around so she could continue talking without me looking at her. I'll give her the benefit of the doubt and assume that she hadn't seen me....except about five minutes later, once I finally gave up on waiting and got up to actually track her down, she grabbed a handful of napkins, came over to us, tossed them on the table and walked away without a word. I even tried to say, because I had stood up, "oh that's what I was l-" and she was already gone. Seriously. I also noticed that a few other people kept trying to flag her down, but somehow between "helping" each person she had to go back up, and laugh about something with her co-worker. I work in customer service, and I understand that forgetting stuff happens, but you don't act like a bitch if someone has to point it out, you apologize. And you don't act like a bitch because your job is interrupting your social time.

Food was good, service was slow. We came on a Saturday around 4pm and while our soups were delivered promptly, everything else came to a halt. We never got refills on our water which was our only beverage and they forgot the sauce we asked for until we already had the check in hand. Wouldn't go again.
I only wish i can go everyday lol great bar and always polite staff, definetly worth it for some good burgers

I forgot just how much food you get at Red Robin. Unlimited fries with your burger, bottomless drinks, massive overflowing burgers bursting with toppings and sauces and fillings - wow. You definitely get your money's worth here (you pay for it in the gym later on though...) We got the tower of onion rings, the bunzai burger with sweet teriyaki and pineapples, the mushroom burger on which the mushrooms seems to multiply before my eyes, and the endless heaps of steak fries. Love the fact that you can ask for as many dipping sauces as you want - keeps your fries interesting, especially on your 3rd basket ;) Love that happy hr prices are all day as well. But with that much food and drinks and alcohol, it will be a while before i come back, simply because of the sheer volume and quantity of food and drink. Still, solid service and decent pricing makes this place a great location if you're so hungry you can eat an entire cow!

Ordered meal to go and was advised it would be ready in 10 minutes. Great I thought. Well when I arrived at red robin I was directed to pick up order in the bar. I paid for order and then waited for another 20 minutes before it arrived. A total of 30 minutes wait for a meal is not unreasonable but I was told 10 and then left hanging for another 20 minutes if they had been honest in the beginning no problem. I would have found other stuff to do meanwhile. The whole idea of phone ahead to go is to save time, my time. These people wasted mine. It won't happen again.

You know, I have eaten at Red Robin a few times and always had a pretty reasonable experience where the food was good and the service was relatively good and efficient. Then I heard Red Robin had Poutine fries, the Canadian specialty, which lead me there, to once again eat at Red Robin. Unfortunately, since I had been to Canada recently, and maybe that is the problem, these fries do not even compare. I mean they have the right Idea, but the wrong cook or pre packaged toppings..   Ok, so thats the appetizer, no biggie. Then I get my "UBERBurger" (the Octoberfest burger special), and I think this is Red Robin, the burgers are always good. Nope. So just ignore the picture in the menu altogether. The last time I saw bacon as thin as that, I was unwrapping a Burger from the Burger King dollar menu, which I would rather had at the time. An over cooked pretzel bun with, well what they call melted "beer cheese" which was just Nacho cheese, the same as your local movie theater pretzel and nacho cheese dip combo, topped my over cooked (burnt) quarter of a german sausage. I only ate half the burger and for me that is hard to do. I have to say the next time I go there it will probably be happy hours and I will have to do what any man would do to get a good meal, Take some shots.. I have to say the waitress was good though..

What do you do when you go to Red Robins and they screw your order twice.  The first burger had this disgusting sauce I specifically told them no sauce.. So cool the waiters got another and to my surprise it came out super quick like less than a minute.. And yeah this burger was cold and the meat was tough WTF. Super disappointed. The manager was cool enough to give us a gift card for a free appetizer. In any case I won't visit again:( I didn't feel like it was worth it.

Ok.service, ok, burgers. Seems like they don't do anything but cook them and serve them. No seasoning at all. Seems like no leadership there at all just a bunch of amateurs running a business...sad. Maybe they didn't even work there they didn't have name badges on but only a few wait staff did also.

I LOVE this Red Robin and I'm so happy it's so close to me. I've tried the soup, salad, fries, burgers, drinks, several of the desserts, and I was always happy with every purchase. The service was always great as well. The only downside is that it's packed ALL the time! There's a line most of the time, especially during peak hours (dinner). Seems like I'm not the only one that likes it so much!

Went during lunch with wife and 2.5 year olds son. Drinks and Boozy milkshake 1. idk name but it was the irish car bomb equivalent 2.grass hopper milkshake 3. Coors light draft All the drinks were just fine,  actually the shakes were pretty darn good   I got a ghost pepper fiery tavern double. The taste was mediocre and like everything else these days labeled ghost pepper, it was not really spicy stuff all. I understand how actually having good with that amount of heat would be bad for business but nevertheless not spicy. Wife got a a burger, with broccoli as a side. The waitress stated that she was sorry it took so long and that they were waiting on the broccoli. Her broccoli was burnt from being in the microwave and the cheese on the burger wasn't melted. none of our food was even warm. The manager and waitress handled it well by taking the burger off our check and sending another order of broccoli. Sadly the broccoli still wasn't much better. I know these things happen, but that was our experience that time

Our food came out cold.  My daughter had noodles...they were cold and dry.  The sauce was warm though.  She was so hungry that she ate the meal.  My sweet potato fries we're cold, they had to bring out fresh ones which were good.  My burger was also cold and it seems like they grabbed a bun toasted it for a half a second and slapped it on the burger.  All in all, just a bad food experience here.  And their solution????  Nothing, just a "sorry about that" and a "thanks for letting us know".  We ended up paying for the whole meal.  We have scratched this RR location off our list.  We won't be back.  Their managerial service is really lacking here.  Our server, Brandon, was very nice though.

Well the food is generally okay tasting.  Service on refillable drinks and sides usually tends to be slow--even when you order refills as soon as they bring your entree to you.  Often times I am done with my entree before I receive a refill.  Which kind of sucks because I would like to eat my fries with my burger...or have my drink to wash my food down.  Why offer bottomless anything if it takes forever to bring it.  Bathrooms are sometimes on the yucky side.  And I dont know if I really care for the machines that sit on the table...you have to pay to play games (one more thing for the kids to whine about while they wait), they take up dining space...but I guess it is nice not to have to wait for your check.

I'm giving this review 3 stars because Alan, one of the managers here was able to make things right at the end of our service and his actions help upgrade this review from a zero star that it should have gotten.  Basically our service was crap. Got seated and waited over 10 minutes for anyone to come take our order. Waitress says they were all confused and didn't know who was supposed to be taking care of our table so no one did. Ordered drinks and Chili con Queso for an appetizer. Got cold cheese with something white floating in it and about 6 chips.  Got our food and all my wife ordered was Sweet Potato Fries and they were cold, soggy and dark like they had been sitting for an hour and then reheated. She immediately asks for new ones and we got them. Then we both run out of our dipping sauces and a manager asks us if we need anything and we ask him for more sauce so he leaves to go get it and we wait and wait and he never comes back. Then our waitress stops by about 5+ minutes later and we ask her for the sauce that the manager was supposed to bring and then we wait and wait for her to come back and she does finally after another 5+ minutes with the wrong sauce. So we wait and wait again. At this point it's been over 15 minutes that we have been waiting for just some ranch that we can't get. Our food is cold and our patience is gone.  Then Alan comes up and asks us if we need anything and we tell him to just forget it and we are done. He asks us what is wrong and we tell him what's been going on and that we come here about once a week and this is the worst service we have ever gotten and he promises to make it right. Alan first tried to bring us new fries and all the sauces we could want but we told him that we are done at this point. So he then offers to comp us our entire meal and he gave us a gift card worth $20. We were pretty damn irritated before Alan came along, but he did a great job at making it right for us and his actions are the only reason we would consider coming back again. He was also working his butt off trying to help the waitresses as much as possible and I got to say that Red Robin is lucky to have him for a manager.  Thanks Alan.

Two stars for terrible service because our waiter took a while to get to us initially. When he took our drink order he took forever to bring them to us and brought us an extra drink we didn't order and charged us for it anyways. When my mom asked for sweetener he passed by us more than a handful of times and never brought her any sweetener for her tea. Knowing he would take forever to get back to us even though he kept passing by I went to the bar and got a beer and asked the bartender for one of the many sweetener containers behind her. I asked for fries to come out before our burgers so we can snack on something he never did that. He brought me a side of fries with my burger which didn't make any sense since its bottomless fries so the side of fries got cold but My husband and I just took from that side after we finished ours. What really annoyed me was the fact that he blamed the Seahawks game for his acting like he had Alzheimers (no offense). He brought a different burger than the one my husband ordered and charged us for that too. I was taken back by how inconsiderate he was being and to top it all off everything we told him to fix on or ticket (I.e. The extra drink charge and the more expensive burger he did not bring out to us) was not fixed. AND... When my husband was done he asked for more fries and those never came either!! He really should have been putting the customers first and not the game.

Ok it was Christmas Eve but I think we should expect good service and prompt attention, which was lacking.  The food came out slow but hot which was good.  People were nice but the place was a mess and there were a bunch of service misses.  Our server was nice enough.  There were others sitting around chatting who, if any manager was paying attention, could have jumped in anywhere to clean up the place.  I think the manager was one of the chatters.  A wasted hour with no real experience reward.  I don't have that high of an expectation in places like this but today, not even close.

Been here many times. Every time the food and service was amazing. Spent my sons birthday here and they made the day special for him with a great song and Sunday! Food is always top notch as well as the drinks.

They have a ton of burger options and their kids Mac n cheese is crack for kids lol... My kid rarely eats, but can somehow almost finish a bowl of mac n cheese at red robin. I like that they also have a low carb "wedgie burger" that is a bun less burger wrapped in 2 lettuce wedgies. Our waitress was great and helpful with the 5 kids we brought and the new payment system is nice if you need to split the bill among a group of people.

Today we waited for 15 minutes before someone who came in after us was about to be seated....the hubby told the hostess he thinks she meant to call us and she apologized and took us back.  Our waitress took awhile to get to us, but she was really busy. She was a very good waitress and made sure our strawberry lemonades were full and we had extra fries.  We have been here a handful of times and my one complaints is, they always seem to bring out food before any silverware is put on the table. Every. Single. Time.  Besides that, the burger is comparable to any other Red Robin's we have been to. The hubby and I get the same order every time: double order of fried mushrooms, two side salads, and a banzai burger cut in half with fries. The fried mushrooms are really juicy and delicious, I always ask for ranch when ordering or they take forever to bring it out. The side salad is a big size and the perfect start to a meal. I love the banzai burger, it has teriyaki sauce smothered burger, cheese, mayo and pineapple and is just a perfect mix. My son loves the grilled chicken skewers and orange slices.

Well, first off it was very drafty and cold in the dining area. The AC was on in February? Server was polite, but forgot essentials such as silverware to stir cream in coffee and didn't bring sugar until he served the food. He didn't come to check on us even after we pushed the call server button. Not very busy, maybe he's new? Overall, Not good.

My friend and I went to red robin this evening and I was very disappointed in the service.  My friend had to ask for campfire sauce with her fries 3x as the server kept forgetting.   The server also never refilled my water and forgot my pesto sauce on my chicken sandwich.  The part that was mostly frustrating was when we cashed out. The machine kept acting up and I hit the help button on the machine.  I swiped my card on the machine but kept getting an error message. The server took over 10 minutes to come help us.  My nephew was getting fussy and it just made everything more frustrating.

I had a nice lunch with my son here. I had a bacon burger instead of fries I got the wedge salad. But my server didnt tell me I would be charged for it...otherwise I would've just got the fries. My son had the kids fish 'n' chips he said it was very good. The reason im giving it only 3 stars is 2 other tables next to us got their food way before us and we were there at least 15min before any of them. And the other reason was our server made us feel rushed. Like she wanted us to hurry up, eat, get out.

There are plenty of reasons that this place should only get one star for my first and last visit.  1. I think our waiter took classes on how to awkwardly pause and stare before speaking.  2. Aside from the expert level of uncomfortable that he provided, our waiter failed to bring us much more than that. No drink refills, no checking on the food, nothing. 3. The burgers were just basically just warmed up garbage. I can honestly say that I've had better tasting burgers from fast food places. The tomato slices were basically see through and they were still twice as thick as the bacon. The actual burgers themselves were closer lukewarm patties of pink play dough than anything. I'm still dealing with the sharp stomach pains from the half that I stupidly managed to choke down.  Why would I give this place two stars after all of that? The onion rings were good.

Alright Red Robin...it's been 3 months since I went on strike because of my last experience. Our experience Friday night was awesome. The wait time, the waiter, the timeliness of the food coming out was all great. Whatever it is you're doing to improve customer satisfaction is working. You've won us back. :)

I used to love coming here. But the service sucks hardcore. Came here on 5/3 around 1250 for lunch. Empty tables and not even busy. Waiter ten minute to get water..? It is now 1:24. And nothing... Waited extra 10 minutes. Saw people who came after us with their food before us. Such a shame. Waved down a waitress informed them abt the shit service. Manager tried to compensate food, but free food does not excuse horrible service. Will never come to this red robins again.

This location is roughly the halfway point on a regular trek for us. Service is often slow especially at opening when it's clearly not busy. Often have waited 40 mins from entering to getting our order when other locations we are in and out in 45 mins tops. Unfortunate because with chain restaurants a level of consistency is expected but this is not the case here.

Yikes! While I love the food at Red Robin, nothing could get me back to this location. Obviously, in looking at the reviews, management and the corporate office don't pay any attention to Yelp. Went here this evening for a birthday party. There were 14 in our party. Sure, I understand with a group this size that things do not always run as smoothly as a 4-top but that being said, this may have been my worst dining experience EVER. Eight people on one end got their orders. I'm figuring the rest of our food will be out soon. No such luck. By the time the remainder of the party got their food, the first eight were finished. Not to mention that my burger AND FRIES were barely luke warm. We also ordered a pasta dish off the kids menu that came out last AND was wrong. Since when does pasta become pizza? Maybe an older child would not have cared but an eighteen month old doesn't do well with a slice or two.  When it comes time to pay the bill, they give you an electronic gadget instead of a check. Nope, doesn't work too well when we have five parties paying separately. Took 20-25 minutes to get the checks figured out. So much for free bottomless fries....wasn't even going to wait for that. From the time we ordered (6:25 pm) until my food came (7:15) is definitely way too long to wait. I will not be going here again EVER.

We came in and it took forever to get our order taken. The food that came out was horrible. From cold dried out fires to an under cooked burger and under cooked chicken. Sauces for the fries and appetizers were scarce and non existent. We regularly eat at the west Olympia location and have great food and service. Unfortunately this location is always subpar and the management doesn't get it. My side salad came out warm it had to of been under the heat lamp for at least 10 minutes. Someone at a senior level in the RR organization needs to get off their ass and give this location some training and quality control!

We have been to quite a few Red Robin restaurants over the years but this was by far the worst experience ever.  The service sucked.  We waited forever for our food and to top it off it came to our table cold.  We asked for fresh fries and by fresh we meant hot and the burger we actually ordered.  After waiting another 10 to 15 minutes we finally got the last burger in our order.  Not to the temperature ordered but rather than wait any longer, we just ate it.  After the long wait everyone else else was done eating so we sat there watching the last person in our party eat.  After this experience, I really don't think we'll be back to this particular Red Robin.  Not to mention the waitress entered the wrong sauce for the burger side and continued to keep bringing the wrong sauce.  And the manager looked like a deer in the headlights when we complained.  Made me think he must get lots of complaints and now he is just oblivious to them all.  The only reason we gave the 1 star is that yelp won't allow you not to mark at least 1 star.

I went to red Robin. told me 15 min wait. then after waiting 15 min they seated another 2 top that came in 5 min after we came in the door very frustrating. another time we went to this location we were the only ones in the restaurant or bar we waited 13 min at our table no water no nothing after being seated as I watched all the wait staff that out numbered us standing around talking by the serving window. We then got up and walked out of the restaurant, the manager came out to see what the problem was. I told will not be going back to this location again even though it is 5 min from my house terrible service

This is easily one of the best Red Robin locations I have ever been to. My husband and I have been coming here at least once a month for the last two years, and have never had a disappointing visit. Even during busy times, we have never waited longer than 10 minutes for a table. Granted, we're a table of two, and easy to seat!  The service here has always been phenomenal, and we've even had a few servers remember us from previous visits! The food always arrives hot, fresh, and shortly after ordering. The burgers are rather large, and they come with bottomless steak fries, which is great if you have a huge appetite like us! They also have Ziosk tablets on every table to make paying a breeze! You can split the bill, swipe your card, use the built-in tip calculator to decide on an appropriate tip, and even print your receipt... all right there at your table!  And for those who aren't sure what to order, you can't go wrong with the Whisky River BBQ Burger! If you're looking for an appetizer, the O-Rings are a classic, and the campfire sauce is a must try. And as for alcoholic drinks - the Blue Moon Shake and the Irish Beer Shake are to die for! If you come here often, or plan to come here often, I would highly recommend signing up for the Red Robin Royalty card. It's free to sign up, and you can get some amazing perks, including random specials/discounts, every 10th burger free, and a yearly birthday meal! Free food? Heck yeah!

Let me start with I used to love red robin. the west side location was the best place to go. So i decided to try this location and goodness I'm not sure if I will go back :/. It's like walking into god damn Ikea there are walls everywhere. I was asked "hey buddy do you know where the restroom is?" I said sorry I have no clue. Ordering drinks was fine. We ordered are food and it took longer then I expected.  For some reason some guy  (not are waitress) brang out like less then half of are food. I'm guessing they ran out of room on the counter or something so after a few mins the people that got there food where finished. After waiting 10 more mins they brang out more food and one person apparently got the wrong order the first food drop off and another person in are party was supposed to have that one. Well that order was not what anyone ordered so it was wrong so she takes what's left of the Half eaten wrong order away and probably throws it away so now that one person still doesn't have anything. mean while I'm done and all of the condensation from my drinks are going onto the table and running off into my lap for some reason all of the tables are not level. Meanwhile are waitress asks if that person would like there salad and they say yes few mins later salad comes and it's almost completely brown. how do not notice the gross salad when making it. Apparently are waitress tried to get the manager to come over and talk to use but they wouldn't come. She kept saying I'll check on that order but didn't give us a time estimate (ETA) She came over to check on us and asked if everything is alright. Um where missing an order. After waiting an extra 25 mins we finally get that order and she apologized a lot and took off that order from our bill. By that time EVERYONE was done so we said f*** it lets box it and get out of here. We waited for a check and after finally asking she said to do it on there table tablets so we finally figured it out and paid and the damn thing was completely out of receipt paper so no receipt. :( The food was actually pretty good other then the bad salad. Our waitress was so nice and apologetic. nothing was her fault. she deserved the tip we gave her and I would like to thank her. I think we should have gotten a gift card or something along with the Order being taken off. Btw: When u sub onion rings for frys. 5 little tiny onion rings does not cut it

Im sure im not the only person to have downloaded the yelp app onto their phone just to write a review intending to perhaps, warn other consumers like myself, what you might be paying for... Its just that i regret that the restaurant that has provoked me to do so is a Red Robin. Lacey Red Robin. One of my favorite places to eat. AND in the city i currently reside in . SMH. Yea bottomless fries alright..more like if u ask me for a refill on our establishment's motto/catch phrase ill kick your BOTTOM all the way into next FRIDay LEST you be expecting a friendly, eager, service with a smile type of response when accomodating requests from paying customers who are under the impression that that is the best part of chosing this place to eat. Sincerely am disappointed because i know sometimes things happen that we cant prevent but its all about how you react. And how genuine you come across to the affected party. So i gave it three more chances... And i think ive gathered enough concrete evidence to establish a hypothesis. Every customer shouldnt have to pay for the mooching freeloading tweeker tendency driven customers attempts to take advantage of an awesome incentive not a lot of places can offer... And if they do, it should be every single customer paying for it and not at the discretion of whoever happens to feel like you're a fat @$$. NO SOUP FOR YOU! End rant.

Very disappointed. Waitress gave us ok service but the food took over an hour to get to our table. It was not even busy! Will never go back again! Next time will drive out to Lakewood. They have better service!

Been to this location twice.  Both times were just... ok.  No refills were offered (both times) until the end of our meal after we asked for the check.  The food was bland but edible.... but with a banner claiming 'Gourmet Burgers', I really expect much better quality.  The game/payment kiosks at the tables are a huge turn off to me- they are always filthy with fingerprints.  We will probably give this place another try in the future, since I've eaten at other locations and had way better experiences.
A bit overpriced. VERY cramped and really depends on your wait staff and the kitchen staff on how great your food is going to be.
Great service, even for the outdoor seating area. The food is really good, very fresh. We got the fried broccoli and I must admit, it was really good. I was surprised.

LOVE this Red Robin. Sadee in the bar was by far my favorite person, but I haven't seen her in a while. I still go there, because the ready of the staff is awesome! The food is great, as usual, and bottomless fries are the bomb! ;D

Wish I had read the reviews before going here... the service was not just terrible, it was completely nonexistent.  My son and I sat for over 20 minutes and never even had anyone take our drink order.  And it was definitely not busy, maybe 5 tables were occupied.  I used the table top computer thing to "call someone to our table", and found that after it flashes for so long, it just shuts off....3 times.  I went to the front and asked to speak to a manager, it took quite a while for her to eventually slowly approach me in a less than excited manner.  I was surprised to find that she herself had walked past our table several times in the time we waited, and never acknowledged us or our flashing computer thing. This let me know that she is managing nothing.  I let her know that we were leaving because of the wait, and she said in a very monotone voice, "well, we can start your food now."  I declined.  She seemed irritated and uncaring, and handed me a gift card for next time.  It seemed as though she had done this many times.  Maybe the place needs a new manager....

The Name "Red Robin" is there to let you know that it's not "Chucky Cheese".  That way, you can tell them apart.   We went there on a Saturday night, and I must say that the service was pretty good.  We were seated within 10 minutes, and didn't have to wait long for a server.   The burgers, well crafted,  were actually thick enough to block light, but not the noise of screaming children, or the obnoxious "Happy Birthday" salutes to the unfortunate victims.   The food is good. You can get anything with some sort of onions on it. Lettuce is a little more scarce.   Food's good, service is worth a tip, but don't forget your ear-buds!

I love the bottomless fries, refillable drinks, & great service (sometimes). They could be faster at acknowledging people that come in the door. We had like 5 people saw us sitting and waiting and no one approached us. When the restaraunt was not even busy. Other wise great food, & i love that kids get a free balloon when you leave. But seriously need better service/waiters/hostess

Fairly new restaurant.   It's their small design format.....pack in as many people as you can and go for tight space and a noisy room.   Check, they succeeded. On our visit the servers were very friendly, but took forever for them to come by and ask if we wanted more fries. No complaints on the quality of the food.   Just loud.

It was a ok place to eat last night. Most every time we go we have no problem this time. we could not get  refills on fries for the life of us. Love the taste of food but when you pay for something you should have to pull teeth to get your food

Negative stars for Matt at the bar. Some stars redeemed by other staff. Read on for why... I was at the bar for the Hawks game, decked out in an early 2000s Tatupu jersey. I'm by myself, one of two women in a sea of men, & a random dude came over to me, standing quite close & leaning in, & asked, "Can I get you a drink?" He had a Patriots tshirt & jeans on. No name tag, no apron, no Red Robin tshirt- so I didn't think he was an employee. He looked at me expectantly, & I was confused & a little uncomfortable- was he hitting on me? Did he work there? So I asked: "Wait, do you work here?" Affronted, he said, "Yeah, isn't it obvious?" I replied, "No, you don't have a name tag or tshirt like all the other employees do." He stormed off & came back two minutes later with an apron & a tag on which he'd written "Red Robin Employee."  He leaned on the table & said, "Better?" I said "Well, now I can tell you're an employee." He said, "Good, I wish there was a way I could tell if you were a Hawks fan before 2012. Football existed before then, you know," & pointed at his Patriots tshirt.  "Wow, you're hostile," I said. He smiled, leaning in even closer, & said, "Drink order?" He eventually brought my drink, but refused to serve me food, telling the bartender that "I didn't like him." She came over & helped me. I told her the exchange- she wasn't surprised by his behavior, saying that he tended to think he was "God's gift." Turns out his name is Matt. (Ladies, beware!) She was super nice & checked in on me for the rest of the time I was there (a couple hours- the duration of the game). He disappeared from the bar completely. I'm not sure whether he's more of a douchebag, or just a baby.

Not a good experience at this Red Robin. Host didn't say a word, just picked up menus and walked over to a table and drooped them on it and walked away. Server also seemed disinterested and somewhat surly. We had to sale for drink refills, we're never offered "bottomless" fries and when we asked got a third of what other RR's serve. Managers couldn't be bothered to check on us, seeing the louts service. Tried to flag one down and they just looked at me and turned away. Worst service ever.

Always stop at Red Robyn when out of town. A place you can always count on for good food. This time it was different.  Ordered food Togo and it was very cold, only have the amount of food you normally get! Very disappointed.

Not-so-great experience today. We sat down, the server (Natasha) brought us waters. And then pretty much never came back despite us having pushed the "call server" button a few times while she passed our table over and over, ignoring the blinking light. She finally came back, turned off our blinking "call server" light and said "sorry girls I had to do something." And then walked away AGAIN. And walked passed our table at least 3 more times before we decided to walk out. She wouldn't even make eye contact and was rude the few seconds she actually did talk to us. Will not be going back.

Got seated and waited over 30 minutes for our server to even take our order. She passed our table multiple times after taking our drink order (which was just water) and at one point came over and said "Sorry, I was doing something" walked away, and passed our table a few more times before we decided on walking out to go somewhere else. It was a pretty slow Sunday afternoon, not a lot of people in the restaurant and multiple employees passed us without any notice. Terrible service and will not be going back.

Update below  Long story short. We eat at red robin all the time.  Tonight we had a large take out order over $80 and the order was made incorrectly.  I called the restaurant and they said come get correct food and the lady tried telling me they saved me $1 since they processed wrong. (Wow) I went back in, got correct order and went home to eat my cold food.  They did give me a $10 card in case I want to gamble with ordering more food from there.   Very disappointed and will go back to driving to west side even though I live in HP.    :-( Red Robin has reached out and resolved my concerns.  As a customer who has been going to them for years I greatly appreciate them showing that their customers are important.   Thank you RED ROBIN :)

I Go here alot with my mother.  We love the tavern burgers. The service is great and fast. They make sure your drinks stay full. They will bring yoy extra fries before and after your meal. The staff can be a little nicer when it comes to expired coupons.  Especially when its an elderly lady. That is why I didnt give a 5 star. I would recommend eating here to anybody who wants to enjoy a nice quite meal with a loved one.

Poor service, like really slow. However, the food is usually good and we're a family with small children so we keep coming back. Tonight we walked out before seating - wasn't busy but wouldn't seat us.

This location used to be excellent. Not sure if they had a change in staff/management, but the last few times we've been in the wait time is very long, and the quality is sad. I placed a to-go order on last Friday, and it was awful. I always get the same thing, a whiskey river BBQ burger, and it was really disappointing. Drenched in mayo, greasy and cold... everything was cold, and we were early to pick it up. I'm not one to complain on Yelp, normally I only do reviews for places when there's something good to say.. hope this place turns around.

Worst Reb Robin I've ever been to. The ONLY reason I'm giving any stars is because our server , Kayla, was amazing.  Attentive, friendly, service with a smile from beginning to end. The server who brought out our food (wrong order too) was lazy and rude. The guy in the dark blue collar shirt, who I assume was the manager on duty, seemed like he hated his job. This place needs new management. Here's my suggestion: let Kayla be manager. Maybe then, this place would have a chance.

This is a smaller Red Robin. Last one I went to, in Oregon, was nice. This one was cramped, small, and noisy. Our burgers were small parties and overdone. Our 'side salad' was out of bag, and wilted enough to be a couple days old at least, not to mention small in quantity. (Supposedly refillable, but quality being what it was, we didn't bother.) My daughter's grilled cheese wasn't even fully melted, her apple slices were just on the edge of browning, and I was halfway done with my burger before I got my shake.  My server, Karina, was nice and doing her best in what I know from experience years ago to be a miserable job. No complaints really there.  We probably will not be back.

Today I went to red Robbins with my roommate we wanted a burger and a milk shake and I came up with the idea to go to the restaurant when we arrived we were seated quite fast while we sat and waited for our server to get are drink order which took over 10 mins(not many people were in the restaurant ) then when it took about the same time to get the milk shake and tea then our food took rather long to come... by the time we got our burgers they were warm and our fries were also just warm ... then are server failed to bring us napkins or anything ? Didn't clear anything off the table as I'm looking around the restaurant it's full of dishes everywhere and they close in 13 minutes as I sit here waiting to get my check and a box for the food... nice service

My first visit was very grateful when I brought my own family for lunch to watch a soccer game and the young waitress was very patient and did what every customer would like plus was treated with a basket refill of chips by the kind waitress wearing glasses and I enjoyed my first visit.  Then my second visit was confusing. I went alone the following week to catch another game and was treated differently (by a different waitress with dyed red hair) I wanted to watch the same game on the same channel I knew they had and the waitress was not "tv smart" when using the guide option and I would assist her with directions but was getting rudely angry at me because she could not and would not listen to me claiming they didn't have the channel.  Finally got the channel and quickly left. Can easily tell she did not want to be there. When I ordered chips n salsa they were brought out in a smaller type basket when they serve mozzarella sticks with the salsa in a little cup on the opposite side they were not in a basket and separate dish like the were before and did not get a refill so i felt I was not wanted there.  efficiency is lacking on presentation  Guest service always depends on the employee which is understandable but for the the first time in my life the customer is always right.  I don't know if Ill show up again.

Worst service ever fries were cold asked for more didn't get then until I was done eating and already payed and had to ask twice were my second drink was never eat at this Red Robin west side is way better

Terrible customer service, poor management. The staff there could use professional training. Even wrote directly to their management team and haven't gotten a response. Good food, but will not return.

Decided to chose this Red Robins to kick back after a long day at work and what a mistake. My waiter was great ,however, the chefs were terrible - at least the one that made my meal. It seemed as if they were done for the day two hours before closing! I got a cold cup of tortilla soup and a whisky river barbecue wrap consisting of lettuce, cheese, and cold chicken. I get the same meal every time I go to any of the red robin restaurants and they topped the chart for worst experience - now I know Red Robins isn't some 5-star restaurant but I was shocked when I got my food, I've never complained about what I have been served ever so it was a big deal to me. In the end the management was understanding and I didn't have to pay for my meal so it worked out in my favor and I'm thankful for that. My waiter was great and he got the tip that would have been the cost of my meal had I paid. This place has potential to be great but maybe could use some extra motivation in the kitchen.

We placed a to go order with this wonderful location and instead of giving us the 20% off our to go order which we had been sent as an email, they instead used one of my loyalty free meals which was only $7.99 which was the cheapest meal we had ordered. That discount was far less than a 20% coupon that I was promised to be able to use. On top of that when we received the food the bun was soggy and the food was terrible. Do not go to this location. When I called to ask why I was not given a 20% discount I was told they have no control. Horrible customer service!!

I used to find Red Robin a great place to visit. This one makes it shameful and regrettable. The Ram is a block away. I should have gone there. The burgers were tiny. The fries were soggy and cold. The server catered to friends and got upset with us when we needed service. I strongly recommend you go somewhere else.

I've come here quite a lot since my first visit to this place. The burgers are nicely proportioned that I never fell unsatisfied when leaving. Fries seem to company along with every burger as well which really pleases my little brother. My favorite is the southern charm! Service is exceptionally well. The only complaint I have is the place is a little crowded and quite cold as well.

If you've ever wanted to eat a burger and fries in the smell of a McDonald's place place this Red Robin is for you. The one in Olympia is even worse. Don't understand why managers and employees can't figure out how to clean properly. There was food on the floor that never got picked up. Dirty tables that sat. Almost exactly the same thing happened to me at Outback Steakhouse in Olympia. I can literally copy and paste this review there too.  My advice is to go to jack n the box across the street and take it home.

I called this location twice today, the first time I selected 'option 3' to speak with 'hospitality team member.' I asked her if they had a veggie burger on their menu, explaining that their website seems to be having some issues and I wasn't able to view the menu online. She said they do have a garden burger, so I asked if there's any way for her to find out if the patty contains wheat. She said she didn't know but that if I called back and selected 'option 1' to place a carry-out order that they would probably know the answer to that question. I followed her instructions, called back and selected 'option 1' to place a carry-out order and asked the girl who answered the phone the exact same question, explaining that their website was not letting me view the menu. She said it served on a wheat bun, I said oh I know but you guys have the gluten free bun option... what I'm wondering is if the patty itself contains wheat. She said she didn't know because she doesn't work in the kitchen. I asked her if there was any way she could find out for me and she said the only way to find out is to look online at the menu. I said, so you're telling me the patties don't come in a box with an ingredient label on it that you can have someone look at for me? I even mentioned that I could call back later, to give her time to find the answer for me.  I'm extremely dissatisfied with the customer service at this location. I've had issues with them in the past and have even had corporate reach out to me to try to resolve the issue. The employees at this location are all very young and immature, every visit has resulted in long wait times for food and drinks, employees are always horsing around and socializing takes priority over customer service. It's fine that they are trying to have fun and enjoy their shift, but within reason. The lack of customer service is absolutely unacceptable and I will not give this location my business ever again.

Everything was great! We went on a Tuesday evening and is wasn't too crowded. Our server was attentive, friendly and professional. Food was hot and fresh and served quickly. The onion ring tower is a must-have. Burgers were cooked as ordered, and actually looked like the menu photos. (shocker). All ages of people were there. No room for dessert, but we'll definitely go back.

Everytime I oder to go they barely give me any fries and its bottomless fries! I even requested for extra fries because they short me everytime... Horrible, im not a child I need more than 6 skimpy fries with my meal.
I'm not happy about the lack of fries in my to-go order. I even asked for extra fries because they are always greedy and I got even less!
We have gone here 5 or 6 times and enjoy the store. Friendly staff, good location, speedy service, and good food of corse! The only bad side of it is a pain to get into off of Galaxy.

I've never had Red Robin and decided to try it out on my birthday (Nov 5th) The fries were ice cold. My burger was cooked to the specifications I indicated, however it was just a regular burger. There was no WOW factor. I've had better burgers for 2 times less the price. For me it wasn't worth the hype and I didn't even finish the burger. Money well wasted.

Came on Veterans Day only had a 10 min wait. The hostess were kind and friendly. Our waitress was really nice as well and informing. Our table and chairs were clean. Bathrooms were clean. Food was great my first time eating at this establishment and I enjoyed it. Oh yeah for you down south people they have that good sweaaaat tea.

I've been to this location twice and so far it can definitely do better. The food was good, the service however wasn't so great. Long waits to get something to drink is one of my pet peeves and both times it took more than 15-20 minutes to get us some refreshments. Our waiter completely disappeared for a long while after taking our order. We assumed he might have had a shift change because we went about 30 minutes without getting appetizers or even seeing him. Luckily a waitress had noticed our food was up so she brought it out for us, all except my sons food. I always ask for the kids food to be brought out as soon as it's ready. Kids can only wait so long.  Anyway, The waitress blamed the waiter by saying he didn't put it in the order but came up with his food almost immediately after we asked for it. I honestly think she just missed it when she grabbed the rest of the food. She did the waitress thing and asked if there was anything else we needed, I asked about a drink I had ordered from the bar and didn't receive. She said she'd get it right away but never came back. Anyway, we didn't have much service that night. It was as if we had fallen through the cracks. Surprisingly about 10 minutes before we were done eating, our initial waiter walks by our table and smiles at us and asks if everything was going well. I was with my parents and they're pretty polite so they didn't say anything but smiled and nodded. Didn't get drinks or fry baskets filled which was a bummer, I like to stuff my face with fries at Red Robin's. My drink showed up at the very end in case you were wondering. I didn't want to make my fam wait and watch me finish it so I just left it. The stars I gave were for the food alone.

15 min wait for me and a kid. Not bad since it was busy. Server was nice, but totally overwhelmed. I ordered 1 burger and a kids meal and the table next to me was able to get drinks, app, and their meals and finish it before we got our food. So basically we sat there for an hour and just walked out since we didn't even get to eat. It's our first visit ever  to a Red Robin and probably our last.

This is a fairly new location. The manager was awesome but I don't understand the call center for take out?? So stupid. Also. When you order a to go order you should pack atleast 2 servings of fries since I can't have bottomless.. yet paying 16$ for 10 fries and a soggy crispy chicken sandwich :(

The reason for the lack of stars is simply a matter of the end of our visit when trying to pay. My boyfriend had just received a $30 gift card from his boss here and we came in, ordered, ate- it was fine. but it was pretty embarrassing for him with his gift card being declined in front of me and everyone else and THEN we hear "Did you get this today" from our waiter, we replied yes.  "Oh, you have to wait 24 hours for it to work."   okay.... that would be nice to know before coming all the way over to eat here solely because of the gift card.. it isn't a common experience either for people to know about because usually when someone buys a gift card, they bought it.. it should be active (or the phone number on the back to activate asap- for visa cards etc).
